summary:
• Susannah's grandad was the Governor-General of Bengal during the famine.
• The famine led to an estimated death toll of millions in Bengal.
• This historical event has had a lasting impact on Bangladesh's politics and society.

• A US embassy worker faces charges for sexually abusing young girls at their residence.
• The allegations involve exploitation of vulnerable individuals in a diplomatic setting.
• International pressure is mounting on the US government to address these serious claims.

• Researchers in Canada have discovered the wreckage of the Endurance, the ship on which Sir Ernest Shackleton's Imperial Trans-Antarctic Expedition ended.
• The expedition was attempting to cross Antarctica from west to east but became stranded when the ship sank during a storm.
• This discovery is significant as it sheds light on one of the most infamous maritime disasters in history.

• Beijing offers pandas as ties with Australia thaw
• China pursues significant expansion of nuclear arsenal, report says

• Russia sends naval fleet to Havana
• Fleet arrives in Cuba for diplomatic visit
• Ships will remain in Cuban waters until September 27th

• Jordan Bardella, 28, may become French Prime Minister.
• French protests express concern over growing far-right influence ahead of elections.
• Protests emphasize need for social justice amid perceived right-wing shift in politics.

• Police shot a man wielding an axe ahead of the Euros match.
• The incident sparked alarm among locals.
• No one was injured during the confrontation.

• An Indian national accused of a murder-for-hire plot has arrived in New York.
• India's Prime Minister, Narendra Modi, faces questions about his leadership style following recent electoral setbacks.
• The government is considering prosecuting author Arundhati Roy under anti-terrorism laws.

• An Iranian national convicted of war crimes has been released from prison as part of a prisoner exchange with Sweden.
• The prisoner was exchanged by Iran and Sweden as part of a diplomatic agreement.
• The individual had been serving time for their involvement in wartime atrocities.

• A massive fire broke out at an Iraqi oil refinery.
• Militants targeted US businesses like KFC due to their involvement in the Gaza conflict.
• The attacks were meant to express opposition to the US's role in supporting Israel during the Gaza crisis.

• Israeli military 'pauses' operations on Gaza road amid political tensions.
• Israel permits aid delivery through the Gaza border via a temporary ceasefire.
• Eight Israeli soldiers die in an attack near Rafah during Eid celebrations, while Gazans face restricted exit routes due to the closure of the Rafah crossing.

• Burns hits century for Italy
• In the 2026 T20 World Cup qualifier
• He scored his first century for Italy

• A Kenyan farmer has emerged as a prominent advocate against climate change, despite its devastating impact on his own livelihood.
• The farmer's skepticism towards climate change stems from his reliance on traditional farming practices that have been passed down through generations.
• As a result, he remains unconvinced by scientific evidence linking human activities to rising global temperatures.

• Vice President killed in plane crash.
• Tributes paid by Malawians.

• Weghorst scores late Netherlands winner
• Match was against Poland
• Netherlands wins

• At least 14 Hajj pilgrims died due to intense heat.
• The incident occurred during the annual pilgrimage to Mecca.
• Authorities are investigating the cause of the deaths.

• Green energy in Spain exceeds demand.
• Excessive green energy can lead to problems.
• There may be too much of a good thing with Spain's green energy.

• Avicii's dad misses his son every minute
• He gets angry with Avicii for leaving 
• He feels sadness and anger simultaneously

• Peace talks scheduled with conditions of Russian withdrawal from Ukraine.
• Ukraine faces military challenges, including shortages of troops.
• Russia demands Ukraine's surrender of four regions to end the conflict.

• A woman completed a 1,000km run in 12 days despite feeling broken.
• Princess Kate attended her first public event since receiving cancer news.
• She has made good progress in her cancer fight according to an update from Princess Kate.

• More people turning away from news, report says
• Biden meets Pope Francis as G-7 wraps up strongly pro-Ukraine summit
